title: Evening showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at several places in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central, Southern, Uva and Northwestern provinces and Mannar and Ampara districts after 1.00 p.m. today (27).

title: ‘Sri Lanka will take two more years to reach GDP similar to 2018’ – CBSL Governor
byline: The Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe says it will take at least two years for Sri Lanka to reach a real GDP value similar to that of 2018.

title: ‘International actions for justice essential as Sri Lanka makes no effort for accountability’: HRW
byline: Human Rights Watch (HRW) says that as long as Sri Lanka makes no effort to attain accountability, international measures to seek justice over alleged human rights abuses and war crimes during Sri Lanka’s military operations against the LTTE are essential.

title: Sri Lankans in South Korea advised to be cautious as wildfires ravage
byline: Sri Lankan Embassy in South Korea has requested Sri Lankan workers to refrain from going to areas where the wildfire is raging.

title: Mihintale Chief Incumbent withdraws from organizing State Poson Festival
byline: The Chief Incumbent of the Mihintale Raja Maha Viharaya, Ven. Walawahengunawewe Dhammarathana Thero, says that he will withdraw from all organizational activities related to this year’s State Poson Festival.

title: India surpasses Sri Lanka to become world’s second largest tea exporter – report
byline: According to data released by the Tea Board of India, India has exported 254 million kg of tea in 2024, thus becoming the second-highest exporter in the world.

title: 15 including school students injured in bus-lorry head-on-collision
byline: Nearly 15 individuals, including school students, have been injured and hospitalized following a head-on collision between a private passenger bus and a small lorry near the Ingiriya District Hospital on the Horana-Ratnapura Road, Ingiriya Police said.

title: Wildlife census report to be released tomorrow
byline: Minister of Agriculture, Livestock, Lands, and Irrigation K.D. Lalkantha states that necessary steps will be taken to manage wild animals based on the recent census conducted.

title: Former ASP Udugampola acquitted from Millennium City case
byline: The Colombo High Court has acquitted former Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP) Kulasiri Udugampola from the charges of revealing confidential information regarding Army intelligence personnel.

title: Trump auto tariffs: President slaps 25% duties on car imports to US
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday unveiled a 25% tariff on imported cars and light trucks starting next week, widening the global trade war he kicked off upon regaining the White House this year in a move auto industry experts expect will drive up prices and stymie production.

title: Colombo HC Judge recuses from Namal Rajapaksa’s money laundering case
byline: Colombo High Court judge Manjula Thilakaratne has announced his recusal from the money laundering case filed against Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa in connection with the controversial ‘Krrish’ project today (27).

title: Two dead, one injured as bowser plunges into 30-foot precipice
byline: Two persons have been killed and another injured after a bowser carrying rubber latex plunged into a 30-foot precipice on the Baduraliya-Kalawana road near the Kodippili Kanda Sumana Saman Devalaya.

title: Maximum spending limit for LG Election candidates announced
byline: The Election Commission of Sri Lanka has announced the maximum spending limit allowed for each candidate for campaigning during the upcoming Local Government (LG) Elections.

title: Namal’s money laundering case delayed as second Judge recuses
byline: The second High Court Judge appointed to hear the money laundering case filed against Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa in connection with the controversial ‘Krrish’ project has also announced his recusal from the case.

title: Gigil: The new word in the dictionary for overwhelming cuteness
byline: Ever found yourself speechless in the presence of overwhelming cuteness, like your baby nephew or the cat video you saw on Instagram? There’s now a word for it: gigil.

title: Over 11,000 dengue cases reported in Sri Lanka this year
byline: A three-day special mosquito control program has been implemented in eight districts, starting today (27).

title: MP Chamara Sampath questioned by Bribery Commission
byline: The New Democratic Front’s (NDF) Badulla District MP Chamara Sampath Dassanayake is currently being questioned by the officials of the Bribery Commission, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: MP Chamara Sampath arrested
byline: The New Democratic Front’s (NDF) Badulla District MP Chamara Sampath Dassanayake has been arrested by the Bribery Commission.

title: Mannar, Poonakari and Dehiattakandiya LG Polls on May 6
byline: The elections for the Poonakari, Mannar, and Dehiattakandiya local government institutions will be held together with the 2025 Local Government (LG) Polls, the Election Commission announced.

title: Postal voting dates announced for LG Polls
byline: The Election Commission of Sri Lanka has announced the dates allocated for the marking of postal votes in the 2025 Local Government (LG) Elections.

title: ‘People should get used to relatively low banking interest rates’: CBSL Governor
byline: Sri Lanka’s investment environment needs diversification to provide better opportunities for both the public and corporations, Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe stated while addressing the ‘Invest Sri Lanka’ forum held in Colombo today (27).

title: Four suspects remanded over Colombo nightclub brawl
byline: Four suspects who surrendered to the Central Crime Investigation Bureau (CCIB) in connection with an assault incident that took place in front of a nightclub at Union Place in Colombo on Saturday (22) night have been remanded until April 1.

title: MP Chamara Sampath granted bail
byline: The New Democratic Front’s (NDF) Badulla District MP Chamara Sampath Dassanayake who was arrested by the Bribery Commission has been granted bail by the Colombo Magistrate’s Court.

title: Weather advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued an ‘Amber’ advisory for severe lightning for several provinces and districts.

title: Chamara Sampath remanded over another bribery case
byline: Badulla District MP Chamara Sampath Dassanayake has been remanded until April 01 in connection with another bribery allegation, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Tourist submarine sinks off Egypt’s coast, leaving 6 dead and 9 injured
byline: Six people died and nine were injured when a tourist submarine carrying 45 passengers sank off the Egyptian coast Thursday, said provincial officials. They were speaking on condition of anonymity because they were not authorized to brief the media.

title: 97 Indian fishermen currently in custody of Sri Lanka: Jaishankar
byline: A total of 97 Indian fishermen are currently in the custody of Sri Lanka, of which 83 are serving sentences, three awaiting trial and 11 were apprehended on Thursday, Indian External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar informed the Indian parliament (Rajya Sabha).

title: Infra, connectivity to be key focus during Modi’s Sri Lanka visit – report
byline: During Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s upcoming Sri Lanka visit, key focus will be on infrastructure development, with railway projects expected to be inaugurated in Anuradhapura, including track upgradation, signalling and launch of NTPC Sampur Solar Project.

title: Trump says larger tariffs could be imposed on Canada, EU if they cause US ‘economic harm’
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday that larger tariffs could be placed on the European Union and Canada if they both work together “to do economic harm to the USA.”
